custom_item_1.description: iOS Compliance Policy - Managed Email Profile Required
custom_item_1.info: This control determines whether a managed email profile is required.
custom_item_1.solution: From the Intune console, open the compliance policy. Under 'Email' verify that 'Unable to setup email on the device' is set to 'Require'.

custom_item_2.info: This control determines whether jailbroken devices have access.
custom_item_2.solution: From the Intune console, open the compliance policy. Under 'Device Health' verify that 'Jailbroken devices' is set to 'Block'.

custom_item_3.description: iOS Compliance Policy - Device Threat Level
custom_item_3.info: This control determines what threat level devices must comply with the Threat Defense service to stay in compliance.
custom_item_3.solution: From the Intune console, open the compliance policy. Under 'Device Health' verify that 'Require the device to be at or under the Device Threat Level' is configured appropriately.

custom_item_4.description: iOS Compliance Policy - Block Simple Passwords
custom_item_4.info: This control determines whether simple passwords such as 1111 or 1234 are allowed.
custom_item_4.solution: From the Intune console, open the compliance policy. Under 'System Security' verify that 'Simple passwords' is set to 'Block'.

custom_item_5.description: iOS Compliance Policy - Require a password to unlock mobile devices
custom_item_5.info: This control determines whether a password is required before allowing access to the device via the touch screen.
custom_item_5.solution: From the Intune console, open the compliance policy. Under 'System Security' verify that 'Require a password to unlock mobile devices' is set to 'Require'.
custom_item_5.regex: Require a password to unlock mobile devices:
custom_item_5.expect: Require a password to unlock mobile devices: true

custom_item_6.description: iOS Compliance Policy - Minimum password length
custom_item_6.info: This control determines whether a minimum length password is required. It is recommended that a passcode of 5 or more be set.
custom_item_6.solution: From the Intune console, open the compliance profile. Under 'System Security' verify that 'Minimum Password Length' is configured correctly.

custom_item_7.description: iOS Compliance Policy - Required password type
custom_item_7.info: This control determines whether alphanumeric passcode is required.
custom_item_7.solution: From the Intune console, open the compliance profile. Under 'System Security' verify that 'Required Password Type' is set to 'Alphanumeric'.

custom_item_8.description: iOS Compliance Policy - Number of non-alphanumeric characters in password
custom_item_8.info: This control determines whether non-alphanumeric characters in the password is required.
custom_item_8.solution: From the Intune console, open the compliance profile. Under 'System Security' verify that 'Number of non-alphanumeric characters in password' is set to 1 or more.
custom_item_8.regex: Number of non-alphanumeric characters in password:
custom_item_8.expect: Number of non-alphanumeric characters in password: [1-4]$

custom_item_9.description: iOS Compliance Policy - Maximum minutes after screen lock before password is required
custom_item_9.info: This control determines the amount of idle time before the screen will lock and reentry of the passcode is required.
custom_item_9.solution: From the Intune console, open the compliance profile. Under 'System Security' verify that the 'Maximum Minutes of Inactivity Before Password is Required' is set to 'Immediately'.
custom_item_9.regex: Maximum minutes after screen lock before password is required:
custom_item_9.expect: Maximum minutes after screen lock before password is required: 0$

custom_item_10.info: This control determines the maximum age of a password.
custom_item_10.solution: From the Intune console, open the compliance profile. Under 'System Security' verify that 'Number of Days Until Password expires' is set to 90 or less.

custom_item_11.description: iOS Compliance Policy - Number of previous passwords to prevent reuse
custom_item_11.info: This control determines the number of allowed previous passwords.
custom_item_11.solution: From the Intune console, open the compliance profile. Under 'System Security' verify that 'Number of previous passwords to prevent reuse' is configured to 5 or more.

custom_item_12.info: This control determines if a user can make account modifications.
custom_item_12.solution: From the Intune console, open the device configuration profile. Under 'All enrollment types' verify that 'Account modification' is set to 'Block'.

custom_item_13.info: This control determines if activation lock is enabled.
custom_item_13.solution: From the Intune console, open the device configuration profile. Under 'All enrollment types' verify that 'Activation Lock' is set to 'Allow'.

custom_item_14.info: This control determines if AirDrop is enabled.
custom_item_14.solution: From the Intune console, open the device configuration profile. Under 'Connected Devices' verify that 'AirDrop' is set to 'Block'.

custom_item_15.description: iOS Device Management - Treat AirDrop as an unmanaged destination
custom_item_15.info: This control determines if AirDrop is treated as an unmanaged destination.
custom_item_15.solution: From the Intune console, open the device configuration profile. Under 'App Store, Doc Viewing, Gaming' verify that 'Treat AirDrop as an unmanaged destination' is set to 'Require'.
custom_item_15.regex: Treat AirDrop as an unmanaged destination:
custom_item_15.expect: Treat AirDrop as an unmanaged destination: true

custom_item_16.description: iOS Device Management - Require AirPlay outgoing requests pairing password
custom_item_16.info: This control determines if outgoing requests over Airplay require a pairing password.
custom_item_16.solution: From the Intune console, open the device configuration profile. Under 'Connected Devices' verify that 'Require AirPlay outgoing requests pairing password' is set to 'Require'.
custom_item_16.regex: Require AirPlay outgoing requests pairing password:
custom_item_16.expect: Require AirPlay outgoing requests pairing password: true

custom_item_17.description: iOS Device Management - Automatic app downloads
custom_item_17.info: This control determines if apps are automatically downloaded when installed from purchases on other devices.
custom_item_17.solution: From the Intune console, open the device configuration profile. Under 'App Store, Doc Viewing, Gaming' verify that 'Automatic app downloads' is set to 'Block'.

custom_item_18.info: This control determines if a user can modify bluetooth settings.
custom_item_18.solution: From the Intune console, open the device configuration profile. Under 'Connected Devices' verify that 'Bluetooth modification' is set to 'Block'.

custom_item_19.info: This control determines whether the camera is allowed.
custom_item_19.solution: From the Intune console, open the device configuration profile. Under 'Built-in Apps' verify that 'Camera' is set to 'Block'.

custom_item_20.description: iOS Device Management - Changes to app cellular data usage settings
custom_item_20.info: This control determines if a user can modify celluar data settings.
custom_item_20.solution: From the Intune console, open the device configuration profile. Under 'Wireless' verify that 'Changes to app cellular data usage settings' is set to 'Block'.
custom_item_20.regex: Block Changes to app cellular data usage settings:
custom_item_20.expect: Block Changes to app cellular data usage settings: true

custom_item_21.info: This control determines if a user can modify personal hotspot settings.
custom_item_21.solution: From the Intune console, open the device configuration profile. Under 'Wireless' verify that 'Personal Hotspot' is set to 'Block'.

custom_item_22.description: iOS Device Management - Untrusted TLS certificates
custom_item_22.info: This control determines whether untrusted TLS certificates are allowed.
custom_item_22.solution: From the Intune console, open the device configuration profile. Under 'General' verify that 'Untrusted TLS certificates' is set to 'Block'.

custom_item_23.description: iOS Device Management - Configuration profile changes
custom_item_23.info: This control determines if a user can modify the device configuration profile.
custom_item_23.solution: From the Intune console, open the device configuration profile. Under 'General' verify that 'Configuration profile changes' is set to 'Block'.

custom_item_24.description: iOS Device Management - Use of the erase all content and settings option on the device
custom_item_24.info: This control determines if a user can erase all content and settings options.
custom_item_24.solution: From the Intune console, open the device configuration profile. Under 'General' verify that 'Use of the erase all content and settings option on the device' is set to 'Block'.
custom_item_24.regex: Block Use of the erase all content and settings option on the device:
custom_item_24.expect: Block Use of the erase all content and settings option on the device: true

custom_item_25.description: iOS Device Management - Device name modification
custom_item_25.info: This control determines if a user can modify the name of the device.
custom_item_25.solution: From the Intune console, open the device configuration profile. Under 'General' verify that 'Device name modification' is set to 'Block'.

custom_item_26.description: iOS Device Management - Share usage data
custom_item_26.info: This control determines whether the device shares usage data.
custom_item_26.solution: From the Intune console, open the device configuration profile. Under 'General' verify that 'Share usage data' is set to 'Block'.

custom_item_27.description: iOS Device Management - Viewing corporate documents in unmanaged apps
custom_item_27.info: This control determines whether viewing of corporate managed documents are allowed to unmanaged apps.
custom_item_27.solution: From the Intune console, open the device configuration profile. Under 'App Store, Doc Viewing, Gaming' verify that 'Viewing corporate documents in unmanaged apps' is set to 'Block'.
custom_item_27.regex: Block Viewing corporate documents in unmanaged apps:
custom_item_27.expect: Block Viewing corporate documents in unmanaged apps: true

custom_item_28.description: iOS Device Management - Find My Friends
custom_item_28.info: This control determines whether Find My Friends is allowed.
custom_item_28.solution: From the Intune console, open the device configuration profile. Under 'Built-in Apps' verify that 'Find My Friends' is set to 'Block'.

custom_item_29.info: This control determines whether Game Center is allowed.
custom_item_29.solution: From the Intune console, open the device configuration profile. Under 'App Store, Doc Viewing, Gaming' verify that 'Game Center' is set to 'Block'.

custom_item_30.description: iOS Device Management - Adding Game Center friends
custom_item_30.info: This control determines whether adding Game Center friends is allowed.
custom_item_30.solution: From the Intune console, open the device configuration profile. Under 'App Store, Doc Viewing, Gaming' verify that 'Adding Game Center friends' is set to 'Block'.
custom_item_30.expect: Block Adding Game Center friends: true

custom_item_31.info: This control determines whether multiplayer gaming is allowed.
custom_item_31.solution: From the Intune console, open the device configuration profile. Under 'App Store, Doc Viewing, Gaming' verify that 'Multiplayer gaming' is set to 'Block'.

custom_item_32.description: iOS Device Management - Download content from iBook store flagged as 'Erotica'
custom_item_32.info: This control determines whether 'erotica' flagged content from the iBook store is allowed.
custom_item_32.solution: From the Intune console, open the device configuration profile. Under 'App Store, Doc Viewing, Gaming' verify that 'Download content from iBook store flagged as 'Erotica'' is set to 'Block'.
custom_item_32.regex: Block Download content from iBook store flagged as Erotica:
custom_item_32.expect: Block Download content from iBook store flagged as Erotica: true

custom_item_33.info: This control determines whether handoff of active work from one iOS or MacOS device to another is allowed.
custom_item_33.solution: From the Intune console, open the device configuration profile. Under 'Cloud and Storage' verify that 'Handoff' is set to 'Block'.

custom_item_34.description: iOS Device Management - Backup to iCloud
custom_item_34.info: This control determines whether backup of the device to iCloud is allowed.
custom_item_34.solution: From the Intune console, open the device configuration profile. Under 'Cloud and Storage' verify that 'Backup to iCloud' is set to 'Block'.

custom_item_35.description: iOS Device Management - Block iCloud Document sync
custom_item_35.info: This control determines whether syncing of documents to iCloud is allowed.
custom_item_35.solution: From the Intune console, open the device configuration profile. Under 'Cloud and Storage' verify that 'Block iCloud Document sync' is set to 'Block'.

custom_item_36.description: iOS Device Management - Managed apps sync to cloud
custom_item_36.info: This control determines whether managed apps syncing to the cloud is allowed.
custom_item_36.solution: From the Intune console, open the device configuration profile. Under 'Cloud and Storage' verify that 'Managed apps sync to cloud' is set to 'Block'.
custom_item_36.regex: Block Managed apps sync to cloud:
custom_item_36.expect: Block Managed apps sync to cloud: true

custom_item_37.description: iOS Device Management - iCloud Photo Library
custom_item_37.info: This control determines whether iCloud Photo Library is allowed.
custom_item_37.solution: From the Intune console, open the device configuration profile. Under 'Cloud and Storage' verify that 'iCloud Photo Library' is set to 'Block'.

custom_item_38.description: iOS Device Management - Photo stream syncing to iCloud
custom_item_38.info: This control determines whether syncing of photos to iCloud is allowed.
custom_item_38.solution: From the Intune console, open the device configuration profile. Under 'Cloud and Storage' verify that 'Photo stream syncing to iCloud' is set to 'Block'.
custom_item_38.regex: Block Photo stream syncing to iCloud:
custom_item_38.expect: Block Photo stream syncing to iCloud: true

custom_item_39.description: iOS Device Management - Shared photo stream
custom_item_39.info: This control determines whether syncing of shared photos to iCloud is allowed.
custom_item_39.solution: From the Intune console, open the device configuration profile. Under 'Cloud and Storage' verify that 'Shared photo stream' is set to 'Block'.

custom_item_40.info: This control determines whether backup encryption is required.
custom_item_40.solution: From the Intune console, open the device configuration profile. Under 'Cloud and Storage' verify that 'Encrypted backup' is set to 'Require'.

custom_item_41.description: iOS Device Management - Explicit iTunes music, podcast, or news content
custom_item_41.info: This control determines whether explicit content is allowed.
custom_item_41.solution: From the Intune console, open the device configuration profile. Under 'App Store, Doc Viewing, Gaming' verify that 'Explicit iTunes music, podcast, or news content' is set to 'Block'.
custom_item_41.regex: Block Explicit iTunes music, podcast, or news content:
custom_item_41.expect: Block Explicit iTunes music, podcast, or news content: true

custom_item_42.description: iOS Device Management - Control Center access while device locked
custom_item_42.info: This control determines whether control center access is allowed while the device is locked.
custom_item_42.solution: From the Intune console, open the device configuration profile. Under 'Locked Screen Experience' verify that 'Control Center access while device locked' is set to 'Block'.
custom_item_42.regex: Block Control Center access while device locked:
custom_item_42.expect: Block Control Center access while device locked: true

custom_item_43.description: iOS Device Management - Notification Center access while device locked
custom_item_43.info: This control determines whether notification center access is allowed while the device is locked.
custom_item_43.solution: From the Intune console, open the device configuration profile. Under 'Locked Screen Experience' verify that 'Notification Center access while device locked' is set to 'Block'.
custom_item_43.regex: Block Notification Center access while device locked:
custom_item_43.expect: Block Notification Center access while device locked: true

custom_item_44.description: iOS Device Management - Wallet notifications while device locked
custom_item_44.info: This control determines whether wallet access is allowed while the device is locked.
custom_item_44.solution: From the Intune console, open the device configuration profile. Under 'Locked Screen Experience' verify that 'Wallet access while device locked' is set to 'Block'.
custom_item_44.regex: Block Wallet notifications while device locked:
custom_item_44.expect: Block Wallet notifications while device locked: true

custom_item_45.description: iOS Device Management - Today view while device locked
custom_item_45.info: This control determines whether Today view is allowed while the device is locked.
custom_item_45.solution: From the Intune console, open the device configuration profile. Under 'Locked Screen Experience' verify that 'Today view while device locked' is set to 'Block'.
custom_item_45.regex: Block Today view while device locked:
custom_item_45.expect: Block Today view while device locked: true

custom_item_46.description: iOS Device Management - Notification settings modification
custom_item_46.info: This control determines whether the user is allowed to modify notification settings on the device.
custom_item_46.solution: From the Intune console, open the device configuration profile. Under 'General' verify that 'Notification settings modification' is set to 'Block'.

custom_item_47.info: This control determines whether the user is allowed to modify passcode settings on the device.
custom_item_47.solution: From the Intune console, open the device configuration profile. Under 'General' verify that 'Passcode modification' is set to 'Block'.

custom_item_48.info: This control determines whether simple passwords are allowed.
custom_item_48.solution: From the Intune console, open the device configuration profile. Under 'Password' verify that 'Simple passwords' is set to 'Block'.

custom_item_49.info: This control determines the maximum age of a password.
custom_item_49.solution: From the Intune console, open the device configuration profile. Under 'Password' verify that 'Password expiration (days)' is set to 90 or less.

custom_item_50.description: iOS Device Management - Number of non-alphanumeric characters in password
custom_item_50.info: This control determines the number of non-alphanumeric characters in a password.
custom_item_50.solution: From the Intune console, open the device configuration profile. Under 'Password' verify that 'Number of non-alphanumeric characters in password' is set to 1 or more.
custom_item_50.regex: Number of non-alphanumeric characters in password:
custom_item_50.expect: Number of non-alphanumeric characters in password: [1-4]$

custom_item_51.description: iOS Device Management - Maximum minutes after screen lock before password is required
custom_item_51.info: This control determines the grace period a device can be unlocked without a password after screen lock.
custom_item_51.solution: From the Intune console, open the device configuration profile. Under 'Password' verify that 'Maximum minutes after screen lock before password is required' is set to 'Immediately'.
custom_item_51.regex: Maximum minutes after screen lock before password is required:
custom_item_51.expect: Maximum minutes after screen lock before password is required: 0$

custom_item_52.description: iOS Device Management - Maximum minutes of inactivity until screen locks
custom_item_52.info: This control determines the minutes of inactivity until the screen locks.
custom_item_52.solution: From the Intune console, open the device configuration profile. Under 'Password' verify that 'Maximum minutes of inactivity until screen locks' is set to 5 or less.
custom_item_52.regex: Maximum minutes of inactivity until screen locks:
custom_item_52.expect: Maximum minutes of inactivity until screen locks: [1-5]$

custom_item_53.description: iOS Device Management - Prevent reuse of previous passwords
custom_item_53.info: This control determines the number of reused passwords that are not allowed.
custom_item_53.solution: From the Intune console, open the device configuration profile. Under 'Password' verify that 'Prevent reuse of previous passwords' is set to 5 or more.

custom_item_54.info: This control determines whether a password is required to unlock the device.
custom_item_54.solution: From the Intune console, open the device configuration profile. Under 'Password' verify that 'Password' is set to 'Require'.

custom_item_55.description: iOS Device Management - Required password type
custom_item_55.info: This control determines what type of password must be used.
custom_item_55.solution: From the Intune console, open the device configuration profile. Under 'Password' verify that 'Required password type' is set to 'Alphanumeric'.

custom_item_56.info: This control determines whether autofill in Safari is allowed.
custom_item_56.solution: From the Intune console, open the device configuration profile. Under 'Built-in Apps' verify that 'Safari Autofill' is set to 'Block'.

custom_item_57.info: This control determines whether pop-ups in Safari is allowed.
custom_item_57.solution: From the Intune console, open the device configuration profile. Under 'Built-in Apps' verify that 'Safari Pop-ups' is set to 'Block'.

custom_item_58.description: iOS Device Management - Safari fraud warnings
custom_item_58.info: This control determines whether fraud warnings in Safari is required.
custom_item_58.solution: From the Intune console, open the device configuration profile. Under 'Built-in Apps' verify that 'Safari fraud warnings' is set to 'Require'.

custom_item_59.info: This control determines if a user can take device screenshots.
custom_item_59.solution: From the Intune console, open the device configuration profile. Under 'General' verify that 'Screen capture' is set to 'Block'.

custom_item_60.info: This control determines if Siri is enabled.
custom_item_60.solution: From the Intune console, open the device configuration profile. Under 'Built-in Apps' verify that 'Siri' is set to 'Block'.

custom_item_61.description: iOS Device Management - Join Wi-Fi networks only using configuration profiles
custom_item_61.info: This control determines whether Wi-Fi can only be joined to preconfigured profiles.
custom_item_61.solution: From the Intune console, open the device configuration profile. Under 'Wireless' verify that 'Join Wi-Fi networks only using configuration profiles' is set to 'Require'.
custom_item_61.regex: Join Wi-Fi networks only using configuration profiles:
custom_item_61.expect: Join Wi-Fi networks only using configuration profiles: true
